comment: There is no argument that we can expand Taylor series up to the 4th term (1st step, -2pts). In step 3. the second equation is wrong (if the upper formula is differentiated -  we cannot get the precise coefficients when some powers of x are hidden in O(h^4)) or just unexplained (if there is a Taylor expansion of $f''$ around  $x$). By this reason one cannot be sure that the coefficient of f''(x) is 4h^2. Finally, it should be explained why the coefficients of like powers of $h$ have to be equal. Note that we don't consider polynomials but some expressions with big-$O$ notation. The answer is correct.
